text: Tan Sri Fong Chan Onn (born 29 February 1944) is a Malaysian politician. He was a vice-president of the Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) and served as a Member of Parliament for Selandar (1999-2004) and Alor Gajah (2004-2013). He was Deputy Minister of Education (1990-1999) and Minister of Human Resources (1999-2008) under Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad. He retired from Parliament in 2013. Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Malaysian politicians Category:People from Negeri Sembilan
title: Fong Chan Onn
